chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick J Eppolite

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick J Eppolite in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Patrick J Eppolite. 
Cases heard at this time are 22CF-154 and 22CF-109.

8:32 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing at this time.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
20CF-154: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Remaining counts will be dismissed.
22CF-109: State agrees to dismiss and read in.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
20CF-154: Count 1: Guilty.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 20CF-154, contrary to the statute section stated therein.
There is a stipulation that Defendant is a repeater.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.
20CF-154: Count 2 and Count 3 and Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-109: Dismissed and read in.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Atty Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Jakobson makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
20CF-154:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 3 years.
Initial confinement for 18 months.
Extended supervision for 18 months.
Concurrent with any sentence if revoked.
Eligible for challenge incarceration program.
Eligible for substance abuse program.
Imposed and Stayed.
Probation for 24 months.
Conditions:
Pay restitution in the amount of $40 to the victim, Kwik Trip store.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.
Submit DNA sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Pay costs and surcharges.

20 days in which to appeal.
Order to Transport /s/ TBE 06/23/22
Order to Transport filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 06/23/22 sp)
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:30 AM Defendant Patrick J Eppolite in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson not in court. Cases 22CF109 and 20CF154.
Court was informed that Atty Jakobson that this case needed to be rescheduled due to a medical complication.
No objections by the State and is aware that the defendant needs more time as well to consider a counter offer.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to Transport /s/ TBE 04/26/22
Order to Transport filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 04/26/22 sp)

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:10 PM Defendant Patrick J Eppolite in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Patrick J Eppolite. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Waiver will be done on record today as Atty Jakobson did not file a written waiver.
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
**DEFENDANT HAS REFUSED TO SIGN THE SIGNATURE BOND**
Order to Produce /s/ TBE 04/11/22
Order to Produce filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 04/11/22 sp)
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Defendant Patrick J Eppolite in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Patrick J Eppolite. 

8:52 AM Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

This is an adjourned initial appearance.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Time limits are waived.

BY THE COURT:
Time limits are waived.

State requests signature bond.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Order to Produce /s/ TBE 04/04/22
Order to Produce filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 04/04/22 sp)

9:20 AM Defendant Patrick J Eppolite not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Oren Jakobson was previously present.

Due to communication issues with the Portage County Jail, State requests the matter be adjourned to next Monday at 9 am.

BY THE COURT:
Court will set matter over for next Monday.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty Oren Jakobson

records.addlTxt: Oren Jakobson
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:01 AM Defendant Patrick J Eppolite in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Address on complaint is correct.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant does not have questions.
Defendant has an attorney that represents him in another case, may have this attorney take this case as well. 

Matter will be adjourned. 
Defendant is willing to waive the time limits. 

State will set this for an adjourned initial appearance.

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for February 22, 2022 @ 9:00 am in Br 1
